title: The Most Clutch Postseason Quarterback Of All Time Is Eli Manning FiveThirtyEight » Features | FiveThirtyEight

type_specific.selection: Saturday’s AFC divisional playoff game featured a matchup between two quarterbacks with clutch reputations: the Baltimore Ravens’ Joe Flacco, who entered the game with a 10-4 lifetime postseason record, and the New England Patriots’ Tom Brady, whose first three playoff seasons all yielded Super Bowl championships.
